text: Saint-Benoît-du-Lac is a community of 50 people, part of the Memphrémagog Regional County Municipality in the Eastern Townships region of Quebec. It only comprises an abbey, a cheese making facility, and its immediate surrounding lands. ==Demographics== ===Population=== Population trend:Statistics Canada: 1996, 2001, 2006, 2011 census {| class="wikitable" |- ! Census ! Population ! Change (%) |- | 2011 | 50 | 4.2% |- | 2006 | 48 | 2.1% |- | 2001 | 47 | 11.3% |- | 1996 | 53 | 7.0% |- | 1991 | 57 | N/A |} ===Language=== Mother tongue (2011) {| class="wikitable" |- ! Language ! Population ! Pct (%) |- | French only | 40 | 72.7% |- | English only | 10 | 18.2% |- | Non-official languages | 5 | 9.1% |} == See also == * Saint Benedict Abbey, Quebec * List of municipalities in Quebec ==References== ==External links== * Official website Category:Municipalities in Quebec Category:Incorporated places in Estrie
